1.text: My son, if you be surety for your friend, if you have stricken your hand with a stranger,

2.text: You are snared with the words of your mouth, you are taken with the words of your mouth.

3.text: Do this now, my son, and deliver yourself, when you are come into the hand of your friend; go, humble yourself, and make sure your friend.

4.text: Give not sleep to your eyes, nor slumber to your eyelids.

5.text: Deliver yourself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

6.text: Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

7.text: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,

8.text: Provides her meat in the summer, and gathers her food in the harvest.

9.text: How long will you sleep, O sluggard? when will you arise out of your sleep?

10.text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

11.text: So shall your poverty come as one that travels, and your want as an armed man.

12.text: A naughty person, a wicked man, walks with a fraudulent mouth.

13.text: He winks with his eyes, he speaks with his feet, he teaches with his fingers;

14.text: Frowardness is in his heart, he devises mischief continually; he sows discord.

15.text: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.

16.text: These six things does the LORD hate: yes, seven are an abomination to him:

17.text: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

18.text: An heart that devises wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,

19.text: A false witness that speaks lies, and he that sows discord among brothers.

20.text: My son, keep your father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of your mother:

21.text: Bind them continually on your heart, and tie them about your neck.

22.text: When you go, it shall lead you; when you sleep, it shall keep you; and when you wake, it shall talk with you.

23.text: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:

24.text: To keep you from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

25.text: Lust not after her beauty in your heart; neither let her take you with her eyelids.

26.text: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.

27.text: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?

28.text: Can one go on hot coals, and his feet not be burned?

29.text: So he that goes in to his neighbor’s wife; whoever touches her shall not be innocent.

30.text: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

31.text: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

32.text: But whoever commits adultery with a woman lacks understanding: he that does it destroys his own soul.

33.text: A wound and dishonor shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

34.text: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

35.text: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though you give many gifts.
